DOC.brief_summary: This study will compare the two methods 5 days holtermonitoring and 30 days thumb electrocardiogram for detection of atrial fibrillation in stroke patients
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation of 5 Days Holter and 30 Days Thumb-ECG for Detection of Atrial Fibrillation in Stroke Patients
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with a newly stroke will be examined with both 5 day holter monitoring and 30 days thumb ECG at the same time. The detection rates of the two methods will be compared
DOC.criteria: stroke or TIA within the last 3 months verified by a CT or a MR scan or unequivocal symptoms and old infarcts visualised on CT or MR age 65 or above patients able to handle the thumbECG written informed consent earlier diagnose of atrial fibrillation pacemaker or ICD device stroke induced by trauma, infection or surgery procedure carotid stenosis of more than 60%
